style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Long Trail Brewing Co
breweries.description: Long Trail Brewery is a microbrewery located in Bridgewater, Vermont, USA. It was opened in May of 1989 by Andy Pherson, who now serves both as the company's president and brewmaster. The company's first brewery was located in the basement of the Bridgewater Woolen Mill in Vermont's Green Mountains, but by 1995 the company had become popular enough that it was able to relocate to a state-of-the-art brewery and visitor center (featuring an open-air deck overlooking the Ottaquechee River) in Bridgewater Corners, VT.

locations.name: Main Brewery

data.name: Black Sails IPA
data.description: Black Sails - the beer brewed in a very contradictory style. The contradiction is in the name of the style - Black IPA or "Black India Pale Ale". The history of this style is not very long - it started just a few years ago. It all started in US and doesn't have any connection to India despite the name. The authors of the style tried to brew a beer which was very similar to IPA in terms of aroma and taste but had a deep black color. The problem which the brewer encountered was that dark malts used to brew dark beer tend to add a coffee-chocolate-burnt flavors and aromas - the characteristics usually not associated with real IPA. Our beer has a distinctive aroma of citruses, tropical fruits, lemon, mango and a bit of pines, having a dry bitter taste full of hops. And a very very light touch of chocolate. But if you drink it with you eyes closed it would be very challenging to discover what is the color of the beer - black beer is usually associated with porters and stouts. The name sends us to those years when Caribbeans were full of pirates, most of them were from England.

Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern is a family-owned, handcrafted microbrewery and full service tavern in Northern Colorado, established in 2003. FCB offers an outstanding line up of 50 ales and lagers that can be found on tap as well as in bottles throughout the U.S. For more information, visit fortcollinsbrewery.com or call 970-472-1499.

data.description: Our second fresh hop offering is brewed with over 10 lbs. of hops per barrel. This dark beer emphasizes the floral, spicy, and citrusy flavor and aroma of our own Cascade hops along with a very subdued malt character of midnight wheat malt.

breweries.name: Backroom Brewery
breweries.description:
Backroom Brewery is a boutique farm brewery nestled in the heart of the Shenandoah River Valley.  We began as a herb farm, growing culinary and medicinal herbs for the garden center trade. 
 
Our herb farm, Sunflower Cottage, grows 120,000 potted herb plants each spring from seeds and cuttings to sell to other garden centers and to our own customers. 
 
In the fall of 2012, we built our hops field.  After all, hops are the herbs that flavor beer.  Hops provide the bitter balance to the sweet malt that feeds yeast, which ferments beer.
 
In 2013 we began the process of creating an ordinance in Warren County to accomodate farm breweries.  By late spring, the process was complete and Backroom Brewery became the first farm brewery in the Northern Shenandoah Valley.
 
Our first hop harvest in August of 2013 was bountiful.  We were brewing in small batches and planning our brewery construction.  In the spring of 2014 we began construction and finished our brewery building plus equipment installation by July of 2014. 
 
Life is good and we are living the dream. 
 
We now have nearly 20 beer recipes approved by the State of VA. 
 
Our tasting room bustles and our scratch kitchen cranks out delicious dishes prepared with our own fresh herbs and farm grown produce in season.
 
In the spring , summer and fall, gardens abound, families enjoy the farm, the scenery, the corn hole, the labyrinth and chalk boards. Pets are welcome.
 
We host 3 annual events, The Virginia Herb Festival (June), BRB Hop Harvest Party (August) and BRB Holiday Market (November). 
 
You are cordially invited to come and drink our beer, eat, play and spend some time.

breweries.name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
breweries.description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

data.name: Black Waves
data.description: Just as the first IPA was originally borne upon the waves, so will you find yourself floating in a sea of hops while black waves of malt wash over you. Toasted malts provide body and flavor while Citra hops dominate the character of this Cascadian Black Ale.

data.name: Black Widow IPA
data.description: Sprecher Black IPA contains seven varieties of malt balanced with a generous amount of predominately Cascade hops. This medium-bodied beer begins smoothly with roasty flavors thanks to the malts, and has a pleasantly bitter finish thanks to the hops. It is both a big beer and delicate one. Every sip will keep your palate engaged.

data.name: Black “Eye” PA
data.description: Hard hitting, with a big citrus punch, this black IPA was created to honor our local roller derby teams. Midnight Wheat Malt is the star of this ale, imparting its dark colors with a combination of light roast flavor. Falconer’s Flight hops give this ale a big citrus flavor with mid to late, and dry hop additions. American yeast leaves this beer with a clean, crisp finish.

data.name: Black-Eye Rye
data.description: Black-Eye Rye is an American-style India Black Ale brewed with rye. Inspired by the popularity of this unique and interesting style, it pours midnight black and features a fluffy cappuccino colored head. Don't let the dark color fool you though, because this is Red Brick's hoppiest beer yet! The aroma features complex tropical fruit notes of mango and peach intermingling with classic citrus and pine, as well as a slight hint of cocoa. The flavor is resinous and piney, complimented by a velvety mouth-feel, and finishes with lingering notes of grapefruit and bittersweet chocolate. It's sure to keep you coming back round after round!

breweries.name: Red Brick Brewing Company
breweries.description:
As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.

Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.

The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.

data.name: Blackbeard's Blackhorn
data.description: This barrel hails from Barbados and sticking with the island theme, we aged our flagship American Black Lager on a bounty of toasted coconut. The result is a perfect marriage between the barrel’s vanilla notes and subtle spicing. Set sail with a bottle or two before they’re gone forever!

data.description:
This nearly opaque Black IPA (aka Cascadian Dark Ale) has toasted caramel & roasted malt nose, with notes of pine and citrus.

As you begin to sip this highly drinkable ale, the Centennial and Citra dry-hopped character will come shining through, balancing the subtle roasted coffee flavor.

breweries.name: Fin City Brewing Co.
breweries.description: “I HAVE AN IDEA!”  That is how it all started.  Two years ago at our annual Brews on the Beach Beer Festival, Hooper’s was approached by a local gentleman named Vince Wright.  He had recently won first place with his “garage brewed” Pumpkin Ale at the infamous Pumpkin Chunkin.  With the growing trend and demand for hand crafted beers, and the fact nothing tastes better to wash down great crabs and old bay, we not only jumped, but dove head first into the world of craft brewing.  We created the brewing equipment, devised a system and here we are today.  With the help and guidance of a few experts along the way Hooper’s brings to you Fin City Brewing, Ocean City’s Oldest Brewery.

data.name: Blacksmith
data.description: Keep a sturdy grip on this hand-forged ale. It is an alloy of premium two-row Alberta barley, roasted to a black malt and infused with quantities of potent, bitter hops. Stalwart and bold, it will douse the coal-fired thirst, slake the spirit and clear the soot from the teeth.

breweries.name: Village Brewery
breweries.description:
Let us gather for mutual benefit. And beer.

Some of the best things happen over beer. Ideas are born, friendships forged, deals struck. Village Brewery began that way too, with friends sharing beers and dreams for a community brewery. A brewery that would support Calgary’s artists and craftspeople. A brewery that would create the excellent ales and lagers our friends and neighbors deserve. It takes a village to raise a beer. And a beer to raise a village.

data.name: Blakkr
data.description: This double black as night IPA is too massive for just one brewery’s efforts. BLAKKR took the trinity of Real Ale Brewing Co., Surly Brewing Co. & Three Floyds Brewing Co. to actualize this crushing ale. Cheers.

breweries.name: Real Ale Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to the Texas Hill Country - the home of Real Ale Brewing Company, where a dedicated team of brewers produces quality handcrafted ales. Utilizing a 60-barrel stainless steel brewing system, we incorporate 100% malted grain, domestic and imported hops, and crystal clear water into our unique recipes. We've been brewing since 1996, and now you can find Real Ale all over the Lone Star State. If you don't see us at your favorite stores, bars, and restaurants, make sure to ask for us by name! Cheers and thanks for your support!

breweries.name: Surly Brewing Company
breweries.description:
While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.
 
Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.

"We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari

breweries.name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.

In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

data.name: Bleak House Black Ale
data.description: Dark Dry Ale, dry-hopped with Juniper and Cascade Hops

style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. breweries.name: The Dandy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Dandy Brewing Company is Calgary’s true Nano-Brewery. We produce inspired ales, with lots of care, in very small batches.

Our custom built, 3BBL brew-house ensures a keen eye to every detail and fosters creativity in both our recipes and beer styles.

Dandy Ales are living beers; naturally conditioned bottles, kegs, and casks. This return to the true ale tradition ensures the living yeast in the unfiltered and unpasteurized beer will continue to work with the premium malt and complex hops from the moment it is pitched in the fermenters, until it passes your lips!

We are pleased to offer a top notch tasting room on site where you can taste any or all of our eight taps, including Dandy favourites and special one-off beers. There are also tours and a small shop to pick up a variety of Dandy merchandise!

We share a passion for not only brewing, but the people, process, experiences, and personal touches that make the real ale experience so special.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Aslin Beer Co.
breweries.description: Since the inception of Aslin Beer Company, Andrew, Kai, & Richard wanted to create a company that they all would want to work for. They have strived to create a culture that celebrates beer with a passion and depth of knowledge that can’t help but be contagious to our customers. We realize that our beer is not the only product we provide, but a long lasting relationship between our company, employees, and customers. Aslin Beer Company doesn’t take itself too seriously. Any why should we? Beer is fun. It’s for kicking back: vacations, parties, hangouts. Along with the fun and humorous atmosphere, our founders’ have a passion and dedication to create a good product and have a commitment to provide the best beer to all passionate beer drinkers alike. Our company will craft only the highest quality ales, lagers, and ciders that will help redefine American beer culture, re-educate the consumer palate and revive people’s passion, and using the highest quality ingredients from around the world.

data.name: Bludgeon Yer Eye
data.description: This India Black Ale is a shining example of stylistic guidelines. Intense fruity and floral aromas abound with a subtle malty fragrance reluctantly piercing through. A deep black color attunes the pallet for rich, dark, roasted malt flavors. The unexpected twist comes when high hop bitterness takes over and resonates profoundly.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

breweries.name: White Lion Brewing Company
breweries.description: White Lion symbolizes grace with limitless boundaries, the consumer being part of something bigger than them; positioned between lessons taught and possibilities inspired by their energy and spirit.

data.name: Boardwalk Black Rye IPA
data.description: When the sun goes down past Crystal Pier, the postcard view of the Pacific fades into the dark. As the tourists head off down the Boardwalk, a distinctly local vibe returns to PB. Boardwalk Black Rye IPA is a spicy black ale with a hop profile that’s pure West Coast. Black and caramelized rye malts add complex spicy and roasted notes, while three massive additions of Ahtanum hops provide the vibrant floral aroma and citrus hop character of a Double IPA. Keep Boardwalk out of the cellar, this hoppy offering is best enjoyed fresh.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

breweries.name: Karl Strauss Brewing Company
breweries.description: Karl Strauss Brewing Company has pioneered the San Diego beer scene since 1989 with innovative beer releases like Mosaic Session Ale, Big Barrel IIPA, and Wreck Alley Imperial Stout. The brewery has won 67 medals over the past five years and its Red Trolley Ale is one of the most award-winning beers in the world. The company is currently ranked #45 on the list of the country’s top craft breweries with sole distribution in California. For more information visit www.karlstrauss.com or call the brewery at (858) 273-2739. Share it. Cheers.

data.name: Boot Strap Black IPA
data.description: This is new style that is not yet defined.  This allowed our Head Brewer to be extremely creative when developing this Ale.  We crafted this Ale with US Whole Flower Hops and "Kicked It Up a Bit" by adding Hops through the Brewing process.  This Ale was crafted with a complex grain build that provides flavors of Chocolate and Coffee that balance out the bitterness of the Hops.

breweries.name: Ship Bottom Brewery
breweries.description: Our humble beginnings started in the Summer of 1995 in Ship Bottom, NJ. Back then we made our first batch of beer using a home brew kit that consisted of a plastic bucket, large spoon, bottling bucket and some bottle caps. We hardly knew what what would be ahead of us 16 years later! We learned a lot over the last 16 years and feel that we really refined our craft. We are a small (Nano) brewer...See More

breweries.name: The Knuckle Brewing Company
breweries.description: The first and only brewpub in legendary downtown Sturgis, SD. We opened our doors in July 2014 and are open 7 days a week. We are brewing on a 10 BBL system and distribute kegs throughout SD. We offer 5 year round beers as well as several rotating selections. The kitchen is open thru lunch and dinner and serves up some great food.

data.name: Bourban Betty
data.description: Do you remember the Dark Helmet Schwarzbier (AKA Black Lager)? Now, imagine the demented brewhouse staff placing a small portion into a used bourbon cask for aging. I know, I know, holy Tom Jones, Batman! You can leave your hat on while quaffing this delectably smooth lager. With hints of oak, bourbon, caramel, and coffee, this complex libation will satisfy your inner beer aficionado.

breweries.name: Olde Main Brewing Co.
breweries.description: At Olde Main Brewing Co. we believe, it's not about the next beer, it's about enjoying the one in your hand. That's why head brewer Jeff "Puff" Irvin and brewer "Big John" Rundall blend traditional brewing practices and modern techniques to craft fresh, full-flavored beers. Taste the true deliciosity at bars, restaurant, and retail stores across Iowa or at the Ames brewery and restaurant.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

breweries.name: Pacific Brewing Laboratory
breweries.description:
Pac Brew Lab started in a garage as a place for Patrick and Bryan to experiment with new beer flavors, styles, and brewing techniques.  What started out as a place to share new creations with friends grew into a bi-monthly, totally free event with hundreds of our “new” friends and great local street food vendors.
 
Patrick and Bryan brew small batches which allows for constant beer experimentation.  They have been known to create exotic beer styles such as their Hibiscus Saison, Squid Ink Black IPA, Chamomile Ale, Lemongrass IPA, and Szechwan Peppercorn Red ale, wine soaked oak aged Brown Ale.  Pac Brew Lab is always on the lookout for new ingredients and inspirations that will help them create new and tantalizing yet pleasing and palatable beers for the public.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

breweries.name: Berkshire Brewing Company
breweries.description: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. is a regional brewery located in South Deerfield, MA, established in 1994 by Christopher T. Lalli and Gary A. Bogoff, a pair of homebrewers with the vision of being Massachusetts’ local brewery. Our goal is to produce clean, fresh, well-balanced ales & lagers in small batches. At the present time we are capable of producing 580 barrels (17,980 gallons) of fresh beer each week. All of our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized and contains no chemical additives or preservatives. As craft brewers, we are now producing nine styles of beer year round and seven seasonals.

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

breweries.name: Right Brain Brewery
breweries.description: Hailed as One of the "Top 5 Local Breweries In The Nation", Right Brain Brewery is known for our culinary inspired beers using only whole ingredients, like Asparagus, Cherry Pies, or smoked Mangalitsa Pig Heads. When we're not busy fending off pirates on the Boardman Lake we like to throw art shows, concerts, and even yoga classes in our brewery. Some people love us, some people hate us, and others just don't understand, but we just want to teach you how to Keep Beer Curious.

breweries.name: Stillwater Artisanal Ales
breweries.description:
"A sincere artist is not one who makes a faithful attempt to put on to canvas what is in front of him, but one who tries to create something which is, in itself, a living thing." -Sir William Dobell

The goal of Stillwater Artisanal is just that, living art. Although packaged within a medium often overlooked for its artistic merits, our desire is to offer something new and intriguing. We present more than just a fine crafted beverage, rather an occasion that evokes an emotion and inspires contemplation. For art is not a sum of actions but rather an approach to life. We draw our inspiration from the world around us, whether that be a season, location, or even humanity itself. Our intent is to encapsulate this muse exhibiting an artistic rendition to the best of our abilities.

breweries.name: The Bronx Brewery
breweries.description:
We're a small craft brewery in the South Bronx, New York and have a maniacal love for two things in this world: beer and the Bronx. Cheers!

The Bronx Brewery is a craft brewer and distributor based in the South Bronx. It launched in 2011 by a small team with two things in common: a maniacal focus on creating high-quality beer and a passion for the Bronx. Its traditionally-crafted ales use only premium and minimally-processed materials to create fresh, bold beer from a borough known for its own uniquely bold character. The team is enthused to bring a rich brewing tradition back to the Bronx and craft a beer that the people of the Bronx and New York City can be proud to call their own.

We have landed in the great town of Ada and hope to meet you soon.

data.name: Buddy Black IPA
data.description: Buddy is a big, bold, in-your-face beer. At 9.1%, Buddy is the largest of our year-round beers, and it incorporates many of our favorite tools in the craft beer toolbox: it's hopped like crazy, it's loaded with rye malt, and it's pitch black. You've gotta be brave to try this one, but those that love it, would kill for it.

With a focus on freshness and variety, CCA has quickly become a favorite watering hole for a clientele that places a strong value on locally-made authentic products.  As CCA grows into the future, we are excited to bring this beer philosophy to a wider audience.

data.name: Busted Pipe
data.description: is our Cascadian-style dark ale. This is a dark and roasted brew with a good size malt bill that helps balance a huge hop schedule. We use three different kinds of hops added multiple times during the brewing process, including dry hops in secondary fermentation. This one is for the hopheads!

breweries.name: Tin Cannon Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are a small brewery that manufactures and sells beer in our tap room. We will be brewing on a 2 barrel (bbl) system when we open - 60 gallons per batch brewed.

Tin Cannon founders John Hilkert and Aaron Ludwig started out as a home brewers. John and Aaron met at church through their kids, who were (and still are) best friends. The kids would plan brew days at Aaron's house so they could play together, and John and Aaron could brew. John had started brewing on a beer kit and Aaron taught him the art of brewing all grain beers on his home made system. The planning of Tin Cannon came through many days of brewing with together in Aaron's dedicated brew room, or in John's garage. Aaron is an engineering guru and built a tremendous 10 gallon brewing system on his own, to include an electric master control panel. John likes to tinker and build stuff, and built stir plates, mash tuns, a kegerator and the like. When two innovative minds get together, they bring ingenuity, focus, style and creativity to each beer they brew. That's what you can expect to get when you come to Tin Cannon Brewing Co.

data.name: Butchertown India Black Ale
data.description:
Butchertown Black Ale celebrates the long forgotten neighborhood of San Francisco where our brewery stands today. This beer is a play on the senses: black as night, but with a deceivingly light body and an IPA-influenced dry-hopping regiment.

Butchertown pours black-brown with a thick, lasting toasted marshmallow head. It has aromas of pine, orange, tangerine, pink grapefruit, & light coffee. Flavors of grapefruit, pine, currants, and red wine come through before overturning to a malt depth intricacy of dark toasted bread, pumpernickel, subtle notes of dark fruits and hints of dark chocolate, tobacco and leather.
data.foodPairings: Butchertown would pair well with savory dishes like smoked duck, dry-aged ribeye, scallops w/ crispy leaks, and Chinese food.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Speakeasy Ales and Lagers
breweries.description: In a typically foggy San Francisco summer in 1997, we were determined to bring our unique West Coast-style beers from the underground to the masses. Defiantly producing small batches of beer in a secret warehouse in San Francisco’s long forgotten Butchertown District, we quickly gained a fiercely loyal following with bold, complex beers and striking 1920’s imagery. Starting with a single, iconic beer that immortalized the spirit of the bootleggers who persevered when America’s taps ran dry—a bold, hoppy amber ale known as Prohibition Ale—we now brew a wide array of acclaimed beers from hoppy pale ales to stouts aged in whiskey barrels. After 16 years of making great beer in the Bay Area, we have grown by leaps and bounds, yet we still produce many of our beers on the original steam-fired brewhouse that started it all.

We are just a small team, in a small warehouse, who share the same vision to make the finest quality beer possible.

data.name: CAPT
data.description: Our California Black IPA embodies Captain Frank Ruhstaller’s legacy, boldy balancing the bright citrus aroma and profile of an IPA with a surprisingly smooth, lightly-roasted chocolate malt body.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Ruhstaller Beer
breweries.description: Captain Frank Ruhstaller was California’s Premier Pioneer Brewer. He embodied the Spirit of California, partnering with local hop and barley farmers to grow the finest ingredients for his beers. 134 years later, Ruhstaller remains committed to the Captain’s legacy. Our beer is made with California hops and barley, grown by farmers we know and trust like Dave & Dia Utterback of the historic Signorotti Hop Ranch in Sloughhouse. When you enjoy a Ruhstaller, you experience the rich, nuanced flavors only California Grown ingredients can deliver. Enjoy!

locations.name: Downtown Taproom
locations.hoursOfOperation: Tu/Wed/Th 3-9 pm, Fr/Sa 3-10 pm, Sun 2-8 pm

data.name: Capt'n Krunkles
data.description:
This beer pays tribute to the most feared captain on the high seas…Capt’n Krunkles!

Made with all the hops that make an IPA a big bitter blaster and all the color that makes a stout look like the La Brea tar pits, Capt’n Krunkles is my version of a Black IPA.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Terrapin Beer Company
breweries.description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Empyrean Brewing Company
breweries.description: It began with a dream that we could brew full-flavored beer in the great state of Nebraska. In late 1990 that dream became our state’s first brewpub, Lazlo’s Brewery & Grill. Since then demand for our beer has grown, so we expanded our pub and Empyrean Brewing Company was born. Today we still dream big even while we hand craft our beers in small flavor–filled batches. So enjoy an Empyrean beer, the taste of dreams come true.

data.name: Cascade Session Black IPA
data.description: Our Cascade Session Black IPA begins with a wintery nose of pine, chocolate, and citrus. This unfiltered dark ale is light in body yet bold in flavor. An avalanche of cascade dry hops is capped by a triumphant dark chocolate finish.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Exile Brewing Company
breweries.description: Inspired by the countless immigrants who have made our country what it is today, Exile Brewing Co. is a hand-crafted brewery fueled by the passion of a burn-bright lifestyle, and driven by a unique sense of gratitude for the customer, community and future of our land.
